019
020package com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.imports;
021
022import java.util.ArrayList;
023import java.util.List;
024import java.util.StringTokenizer;
025import java.util.regex.Matcher;
026import java.util.regex.Pattern;
027
028import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.FileStatefulCheck;
029import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AbstractCheck;
030import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.DetailAST;
031import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.FullIdent;
032import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.TokenTypes;
033import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.CommonUtil;
034
035/**
036 * <p>
037 * Checks that the groups of import declarations appear in the order specified
038 * by the user. If there is an import but its group is not specified in the
039 * configuration such an import should be placed at the end of the import list.
040 * </p>
041 * <p>
042 * The rule consists of:
043 * </p>
044 * <ol>
045 * <li>
046 * STATIC group. This group sets the ordering of static imports.
047 * </li>
048 * <li>
049 * SAME_PACKAGE(n) group. This group sets the ordering of the same package imports.
050 * Imports are considered on SAME_PACKAGE group if <b>n</b> first domains in package
051 * name and import name are identical:
052 * <pre>
053 * package java.util.concurrent.locks;
054 *
055 * import java.io.File;
056 * import java.util.*; //#1
057 * import java.util.List; //#2
058 * import java.util.StringTokenizer; //#3
059 * import java.util.concurrent.*; //#4
060 * import java.util.concurrent.AbstractExecutorService; //#5
061 * import java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport; //#6
062 * import java.util.regex.Pattern; //#7
063 * import java.util.regex.Matcher; //#8
064 * </pre>
065 * If we have SAME_PACKAGE(3) on configuration file, imports #4-6 will be considered as
066 * a SAME_PACKAGE group (java.util.concurrent.*, java.util.concurrent.AbstractExecutorService,
067 * java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport). SAME_PACKAGE(2) will include #1-8.
068 * SAME_PACKAGE(4) will include only #6. SAME_PACKAGE(5) will result in no imports assigned
069 * to SAME_PACKAGE group because actual package java.util.concurrent.locks has only 4 domains.
070 * </li>
071 * <li>
072 * THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE group. This group sets ordering of third party imports.
073 * Third party imports are all imports except STATIC, SAME_PACKAGE(n), STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE and
074 * SPECIAL_IMPORTS.
075 * </li>
076 * <li>
077 * STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE group. By default this group sets ordering of standard java/javax imports.
078 * </li>
079 * <li>
080 * SPECIAL_IMPORTS group. This group may contains some imports that have particular meaning for the
081 * user.
082 * </li>
083 * </ol>
084 * <p>
085 * Use the separator '###' between rules.
086 * </p>
087 * <p>
088 * To set RegExps for THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE and STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE groups use
089 * thirdPartyPackageRegExp and standardPackageRegExp options.
090 * </p>
091 * <p>
092 * Pretty often one import can match more than one group. For example, static import from standard
093 * package or regular expressions are configured to allow one import match multiple groups.
094 * In this case, group will be assigned according to priorities:
095 * </p>
096 * <ol>
097 * <li>
098 * STATIC has top priority
099 * </li>
100 * <li>
101 * SAME_PACKAGE has second priority
102 * </li>
103 * <li>
104 * STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE and SPECIAL_IMPORTS will compete using "best match" rule: longer
105 * matching substring wins; in case of the same length, lower position of matching substring
106 * wins; if position is the same, order of rules in configuration solves the puzzle.
107 * </li>
108 * <li>
109 * THIRD_PARTY has the least priority
110 * </li>
111 * </ol>
112 * <p>
113 * Few examples to illustrate "best match":
114 * </p>
115 * <p>
116 * 1. patterns STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE = "Check", SPECIAL_IMPORTS="ImportOrderCheck" and input file:
117 * </p>
118 * <pre>
119 * import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.imports.CustomImportOrderCheck;
120 * import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.imports.ImportOrderCheck;
121 * </pre>
122 * <p>
123 * Result: imports will be assigned to SPECIAL_IMPORTS, because matching substring length is 16.
124 * Matching substring for STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE is 5.
125 * </p>
126 * <p>
127 * 2. patterns STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE = "Check", SPECIAL_IMPORTS="Avoid" and file:
128 * </p>
129 * <pre>
130 * import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.imports.AvoidStarImportCheck;
131 * </pre>
132 * <p>
133 * Result: import will be assigned to SPECIAL_IMPORTS. Matching substring length is 5 for both
134 * patterns. However, "Avoid" position is lower than "Check" position.
135 * </p>
136 * <ul>
137 * <li>
138 * Property {@code customImportOrderRules} - Specify list of order declaration customizing by user.
139 * Default value is {@code {}}.
140 * </li>
141 * <li>
142 * Property {@code standardPackageRegExp} - Specify RegExp for STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE group imports.
143 * Default value is {@code "^(java|javax)\."}.
144 * </li>
145 * <li>
146 * Property {@code thirdPartyPackageRegExp} - Specify RegExp for THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE group imports.
147 * Default value is {@code ".*"}.
148 * </li>
149 * <li>
150 * Property {@code specialImportsRegExp} - Specify RegExp for SPECIAL_IMPORTS group imports.
151 * Default value is {@code "^$" (empty)}.
152 * </li>
153 * <li>
154 * Property {@code separateLineBetweenGroups} - Force empty line separator between
155 * import groups.
156 * Default value is {@code true}.
157 * </li>
158 * <li>
159 * Property {@code sortImportsInGroupAlphabetically} - Force grouping alphabetically,
160 * in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ASCII#Order">ASCII sort order</a>.
161 * Default value is {@code false}.
162 * </li>
163 * </ul>
164 * <p>
165 * To configure the check so that it matches default Eclipse formatter configuration
166 * (tested on Kepler and Luna releases):
167 * </p>
168 * <ul>
169 * <li>
170 * group of static imports is on the top
171 * </li>
172 * <li>
173 * groups of non-static imports: "java" and "javax" packages first, then "org" and then all other
174 * imports
175 * </li>
176 * <li>
177 * imports will be sorted in the groups
178 * </li>
179 * <li>
180 * groups are separated by single blank line
181 * </li>
182 * </ul>
183 * <p>
184 * Notes:
185 * </p>
186 * <ul>
187 * <li>
188 * "com" package is not mentioned on configuration, because it is ignored by Eclipse Kepler and Luna
189 * (looks like Eclipse defect)
190 * </li>
191 * <li>
192 * configuration below doesn't work in all 100% cases due to inconsistent behavior prior to Mars
193 * release, but covers most scenarios
194 * </li>
195 * </ul>
196 * <pre>
197 * &lt;module name=&quot;CustomImportOrder&quot;&gt;
198 *   &lt;property name=&quot;customImportOrderRules&quot;
199 *     value=&quot;STATIC###STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE###SPECIAL_IMPORTS&quot;/&gt;
200 *   &lt;property name=&quot;specialImportsRegExp&quot; value=&quot;^org\.&quot;/&gt;
201 *   &lt;property name=&quot;sortImportsInGroupAlphabetically&quot; value=&quot;true&quot;/&gt;
202 *   &lt;property name=&quot;separateLineBetweenGroups&quot; value=&quot;true&quot;/&gt;
203 * &lt;/module&gt;
204 * </pre>
205 * <p>
206 * To configure the check so that it matches default Eclipse formatter configuration
207 * (tested on Mars release):
208 * </p>
209 * <ul>
210 * <li>
211 * group of static imports is on the top
212 * </li>
213 * <li>
214 * groups of non-static imports: "java" and "javax" packages first, then "org" and "com",
215 * then all other imports as one group
216 * </li>
217 * <li>
218 * imports will be sorted in the groups
219 * </li>
220 * <li>
221 * groups are separated by one blank line
222 * </li>
223 * </ul>
224 * <pre>
225 * &lt;module name=&quot;CustomImportOrder&quot;&gt;
226 *   &lt;property name=&quot;customImportOrderRules&quot;
227 *     value=&quot;STATIC###STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE###SPECIAL_IMPORTS###THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE&quot;/&gt;
228 *   &lt;property name=&quot;specialImportsRegExp&quot; value=&quot;^org\.&quot;/&gt;
229 *   &lt;property name=&quot;thirdPartyPackageRegExp&quot; value=&quot;^com\.&quot;/&gt;
230 *   &lt;property name=&quot;sortImportsInGroupAlphabetically&quot; value=&quot;true&quot;/&gt;
231 *   &lt;property name=&quot;separateLineBetweenGroups&quot; value=&quot;true&quot;/&gt;
232 * &lt;/module&gt;
233 * </pre>
234 * <p>
235 * To configure the check so that it matches default IntelliJ IDEA formatter configuration
236 * (tested on v14):
237 * </p>
238 * <ul>
239 * <li>
240 * group of static imports is on the bottom
241 * </li>
242 * <li>
243 * groups of non-static imports: all imports except of "javax" and "java", then "javax" and "java"
244 * </li>
245 * <li>
246 * imports will be sorted in the groups
247 * </li>
248 * <li>
249 * groups are separated by one blank line
250 * </li>
251 * </ul>
252 * <p>
253 * Note: "separated" option is disabled because IDEA default has blank line between "java" and
254 * static imports, and no blank line between "javax" and "java"
255 * </p>
256 * <pre>
257 * &lt;module name="CustomImportOrder"&gt;
258 *   &lt;property name="customImportOrderRules"
259 *     value="THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE###SPECIAL_IMPORTS###STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE###STATIC"/&gt;
260 *   &lt;property name="specialImportsRegExp" value="^javax\."/&gt;
261 *   &lt;property name="standardPackageRegExp" value="^java\."/&gt;
262 *   &lt;property name="sortImportsInGroupAlphabetically" value="true"/&gt;
263 *   &lt;property name="separateLineBetweenGroups" value="false"/&gt;
264 * &lt;/module&gt;
265 * </pre>
266 * <p>
267 * To configure the check so that it matches default NetBeans formatter configuration
268 * (tested on v8):
269 * </p>
270 * <ul>
271 * <li>
272 * groups of non-static imports are not defined, all imports will be sorted as a one group
273 * </li>
274 * <li>
275 * static imports are not separated, they will be sorted along with other imports
276 * </li>
277 * </ul>
278 * <pre>
279 * &lt;module name=&quot;CustomImportOrder&quot;/&gt;
280 * </pre>
281 * <p>
282 * To set RegExps for THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE and STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE groups use
283 * thirdPartyPackageRegExp and standardPackageRegExp options.
284 * </p>
285 * <pre>
286 * &lt;module name=&quot;CustomImportOrder&quot;&gt;
287 *   &lt;property name=&quot;customImportOrderRules&quot;
288 *     value=&quot;STATIC###SAME_PACKAGE(3)###THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE###STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE&quot;/&gt;
289 *   &lt;property name=&quot;thirdPartyPackageRegExp&quot; value=&quot;^(com|org)\.&quot;/&gt;
290 *   &lt;property name=&quot;standardPackageRegExp&quot; value=&quot;^(java|javax)\.&quot;/&gt;
291 * &lt;/module&gt;
292 * </pre>
293 * <p>
294 * Also, this check can be configured to force empty line separator between
295 * import groups. For example.
296 * </p>
297 * <pre>
298 * &lt;module name=&quot;CustomImportOrder&quot;&gt;
299 *   &lt;property name=&quot;separateLineBetweenGroups&quot; value=&quot;true&quot;/&gt;
300 * &lt;/module&gt;
301 * </pre>
302 * <p>
303 * It is possible to enforce
304 * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ASCII#Order">ASCII sort order</a>
305 * of imports in groups using the following configuration:
306 * </p>
307 * <pre>
308 * &lt;module name=&quot;CustomImportOrder&quot;&gt;
309 *   &lt;property name=&quot;sortImportsInGroupAlphabetically&quot; value=&quot;true&quot;/&gt;
310 * &lt;/module&gt;
311 * </pre>
312 * <p>
313 * Example of ASCII order:
314 * </p>
315 * <pre>
316 * import java.awt.Dialog;
317 * import java.awt.Window;
318 * import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
319 * import java.awt.Frame; // violation here - in ASCII order 'F' should go before 'c',
320 *                        // as all uppercase come before lowercase letters
321 * </pre>
322 * <p>
323 * To force checking imports sequence such as:
324 * </p>
325 * <pre>
326 * package com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.imports;
327 *
328 * import com.google.common.annotations.GwtCompatible;
329 * import com.google.common.annotations.Beta;
330 * import com.google.common.annotations.VisibleForTesting;
331 *
332 * import org.abego.treelayout.Configuration;
333 *
334 * import static sun.tools.util.ModifierFilter.ALL_ACCESS;
335 *
336 * import com.google.common.annotations.GwtCompatible; // violation here - should be in the
337 *                                                     // THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE group
338 * import android.*;
339 * </pre>
340 * <p>
341 * configure as follows:
342 * </p>
343 * <pre>
344 * &lt;module name=&quot;CustomImportOrder&quot;&gt;
345 *   &lt;property name=&quot;customImportOrderRules&quot;
346 *     value=&quot;SAME_PACKAGE(3)###THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE###STATIC###SPECIAL_IMPORTS&quot;/&gt;
347 *   &lt;property name=&quot;specialImportsRegExp&quot; value=&quot;^android\.&quot;/&gt;
348 * &lt;/module&gt;
349 * </pre>
350 *
351 * @since 5.8
352 */
353@FileStatefulCheck
354public class CustomImportOrderCheck extends AbstractCheck {
355
356    /**
357     * A key is pointing to the warning message text in "messages.properties"
358     * file.
359     */
360    public static final String MSG_LINE_SEPARATOR = "custom.import.order.line.separator";
361
362    /**
363     * A key is pointing to the warning message text in "messages.properties"
364     * file.
365     */
366    public static final String MSG_SEPARATED_IN_GROUP = "custom.import.order.separated.internally";
367
368    /**
369     * A key is pointing to the warning message text in "messages.properties"
370     * file.
371     */
372    public static final String MSG_LEX = "custom.import.order.lex";
373
374    /**
375     * A key is pointing to the warning message text in "messages.properties"
376     * file.
377     */
378    public static final String MSG_NONGROUP_IMPORT = "custom.import.order.nonGroup.import";
379
380    /**
381     * A key is pointing to the warning message text in "messages.properties"
382     * file.
383     */
384    public static final String MSG_NONGROUP_EXPECTED = "custom.import.order.nonGroup.expected";
385
386    /**
387     * A key is pointing to the warning message text in "messages.properties"
388     * file.
389     */
390    public static final String MSG_ORDER = "custom.import.order";
391
392    /** STATIC group name. */
393    public static final String STATIC_RULE_GROUP = "STATIC";
394
395    /** SAME_PACKAGE group name. */
396    public static final String SAME_PACKAGE_RULE_GROUP = "SAME_PACKAGE";
397
398    /** THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE group name. */
399    public static final String THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE_RULE_GROUP = "THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE";
400
401    /** STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE group name. */
402    public static final String STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE_RULE_GROUP = "STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE";
403
404    /** SPECIAL_IMPORTS group name. */
405    public static final String SPECIAL_IMPORTS_RULE_GROUP = "SPECIAL_IMPORTS";
406
407    /** NON_GROUP group name. */
408    private static final String NON_GROUP_RULE_GROUP = "NOT_ASSIGNED_TO_ANY_GROUP";
409
410    /** Pattern used to separate groups of imports. */
411    private static final Pattern GROUP_SEPARATOR_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("\\s*###\\s*");
412
413    /** Specify list of order declaration customizing by user. */
414    private final List<String> customImportOrderRules = new ArrayList<>();
415
416    /** Contains objects with import attributes. */
417    private final List<ImportDetails> importToGroupList = new ArrayList<>();
418
419    /** Specify RegExp for SAME_PACKAGE group imports. */
420    private String samePackageDomainsRegExp = "";
421
422    /** Specify RegExp for STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE group imports. */
423    private Pattern standardPackageRegExp = Pattern.compile("^(java|javax)\\.");
424
425    /** Specify RegExp for THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE group imports. */
426    private Pattern thirdPartyPackageRegExp = Pattern.compile(".*");
427
428    /** Specify RegExp for SPECIAL_IMPORTS group imports. */
429    private Pattern specialImportsRegExp = Pattern.compile("^$");
430
431    /** Force empty line separator between import groups. */
432    private boolean separateLineBetweenGroups = true;
433
434    /**
435     * Force grouping alphabetically,
436     * in <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ASCII#Order"> ASCII sort order</a>.
437     */
438    private boolean sortImportsInGroupAlphabetically;
439
440    /** Number of first domains for SAME_PACKAGE group. */
441    private int samePackageMatchingDepth = 2;
442
443    /**
444     * Setter to specify RegExp for STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE group imports.
445     * @param regexp
446     *        user value.
447     */
448    public final void setStandardPackageRegExp(Pattern regexp) {
449        standardPackageRegExp = regexp;
450    }
451
452    /**
453     * Setter to specify RegExp for THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE group imports.
454     * @param regexp
455     *        user value.
456     */
457    public final void setThirdPartyPackageRegExp(Pattern regexp) {
458        thirdPartyPackageRegExp = regexp;
459    }
460
461    /**
462     * Setter to specify RegExp for SPECIAL_IMPORTS group imports.
463     * @param regexp
464     *        user value.
465     */
466    public final void setSpecialImportsRegExp(Pattern regexp) {
467        specialImportsRegExp = regexp;
468    }
469
470    /**
471     * Setter to force empty line separator between import groups.
472     * @param value
473     *        user value.
474     */
475    public final void setSeparateLineBetweenGroups(boolean value) {
476        separateLineBetweenGroups = value;
477    }
478
479    /**
480     * Setter to force grouping alphabetically, in
481     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ASCII#Order">ASCII sort order</a>.
482     * @param value
483     *        user value.
484     */
485    public final void setSortImportsInGroupAlphabetically(boolean value) {
486        sortImportsInGroupAlphabetically = value;
487    }
488
489    /**
490     * Setter to specify list of order declaration customizing by user.
491     * @param inputCustomImportOrder
492     *        user value.
493     */
494    public final void setCustomImportOrderRules(final String inputCustomImportOrder) {
495        for (String currentState : GROUP_SEPARATOR_PATTERN.split(inputCustomImportOrder)) {
496            addRulesToList(currentState);
497        }
498        customImportOrderRules.add(NON_GROUP_RULE_GROUP);
499    }
500
501    @Override
502    public int[] getDefaultTokens() {
503        return getRequiredTokens();
504    }
505
506    @Override
507    public int[] getAcceptableTokens() {
508        return getRequiredTokens();
509    }
510
511    @Override
512    public int[] getRequiredTokens() {
513        return new int[] {
514            TokenTypes.IMPORT,
515            TokenTypes.STATIC_IMPORT,
516            TokenTypes.PACKAGE_DEF,
517        };
518    }
519
520    @Override
521    public void beginTree(DetailAST rootAST) {
522        importToGroupList.clear();
523    }
524
525    @Override
526    public void visitToken(DetailAST ast) {
527        if (ast.getType() == TokenTypes.PACKAGE_DEF) {
528            samePackageDomainsRegExp = createSamePackageRegexp(
529                    samePackageMatchingDepth, ast);
530        }
531        else {
532            final String importFullPath = getFullImportIdent(ast);
533            final int lineNo = ast.getLineNo();
534            final int endLineNo = ast.getLastChild().getLineNo();
535            final boolean isStatic = ast.getType() == TokenTypes.STATIC_IMPORT;
536            importToGroupList.add(new ImportDetails(importFullPath,
537                    lineNo, endLineNo, getImportGroup(isStatic, importFullPath),
538                    isStatic));
539        }
540    }
541
542    @Override
543    public void finishTree(DetailAST rootAST) {
544        if (!importToGroupList.isEmpty()) {
545            finishImportList();
546        }
547    }
548
549    /** Examine the order of all the imports and log any violations. */
550    private void finishImportList() {
551        String currentGroup = getFirstGroup();
552        int currentGroupNumber = customImportOrderRules.indexOf(currentGroup);
553        ImportDetails previousImportObjectFromCurrentGroup = null;
554        String previousImportFromCurrentGroup = null;
555
556        for (ImportDetails importObject : importToGroupList) {
557            final String importGroup = importObject.getImportGroup();
558            final String fullImportIdent = importObject.getImportFullPath();
559
560            if (importGroup.equals(currentGroup)) {
561                validateExtraEmptyLine(previousImportObjectFromCurrentGroup,
562                        importObject, fullImportIdent);
563                if (isAlphabeticalOrderBroken(previousImportFromCurrentGroup, fullImportIdent)) {
564                    log(importObject.getStartLineNumber(), MSG_LEX,
565                            fullImportIdent, previousImportFromCurrentGroup);
566                }
567                else {
568                    previousImportFromCurrentGroup = fullImportIdent;
569                }
570                previousImportObjectFromCurrentGroup = importObject;
571            }
572            else {
573                // not the last group, last one is always NON_GROUP
574                if (customImportOrderRules.size() > currentGroupNumber + 1) {
575                    final String nextGroup = getNextImportGroup(currentGroupNumber + 1);
576                    if (importGroup.equals(nextGroup)) {
577                        validateMissedEmptyLine(previousImportObjectFromCurrentGroup,
578                                importObject, fullImportIdent);
579                        currentGroup = nextGroup;
580                        currentGroupNumber = customImportOrderRules.indexOf(nextGroup);
581                        previousImportFromCurrentGroup = fullImportIdent;
582                    }
583                    else {
584                        logWrongImportGroupOrder(importObject.getStartLineNumber(),
585                                importGroup, nextGroup, fullImportIdent);
586                    }
587                    previousImportObjectFromCurrentGroup = importObject;
588                }
589                else {
590                    logWrongImportGroupOrder(importObject.getStartLineNumber(),
591                            importGroup, currentGroup, fullImportIdent);
592                }
593            }
594        }
595    }
596
597    /**
598     * Log violation if empty line is missed.
599     * @param previousImport previous import from current group.
600     * @param importObject current import.
601     * @param fullImportIdent full import identifier.
602     */
603    private void validateMissedEmptyLine(ImportDetails previousImport,
604                                         ImportDetails importObject, String fullImportIdent) {
605        if (isEmptyLineMissed(previousImport, importObject)) {
606            log(importObject.getStartLineNumber(), MSG_LINE_SEPARATOR, fullImportIdent);
607        }
608    }
609
610    /**
611     * Log violation if extra empty line is present.
612     * @param previousImport previous import from current group.
613     * @param importObject current import.
614     * @param fullImportIdent full import identifier.
615     */
616    private void validateExtraEmptyLine(ImportDetails previousImport,
617                                        ImportDetails importObject, String fullImportIdent) {
618        if (isSeparatedByExtraEmptyLine(previousImport, importObject)) {
619            log(importObject.getStartLineNumber(), MSG_SEPARATED_IN_GROUP, fullImportIdent);
620        }
621    }
622
623    /**
624     * Get first import group.
625     *
626     * @return
627     *        first import group of file.
628     */
629    private String getFirstGroup() {
630        final ImportDetails firstImport = importToGroupList.get(0);
631        return getImportGroup(firstImport.isStaticImport(),
632                firstImport.getImportFullPath());
633    }
634
635    /**
636     * Examine alphabetical order of imports.
637     *
638     * @param previousImport
639     *        previous import of current group.
640     * @param currentImport
641     *        current import.
642     * @return
643     *        true, if previous and current import are not in alphabetical order.
644     */
645    private boolean isAlphabeticalOrderBroken(String previousImport,
646                                              String currentImport) {
647        return sortImportsInGroupAlphabetically
648                && previousImport != null
649                && compareImports(currentImport, previousImport) < 0;
650    }
651
652    /**
653     * Examine empty lines between groups.
654     *
655     * @param previousImportObject
656     *        previous import in current group.
657     * @param currentImportObject
658     *        current import.
659     * @return
660     *        true, if current import NOT separated from previous import by empty line.
661     */
662    private boolean isEmptyLineMissed(ImportDetails previousImportObject,
663                                      ImportDetails currentImportObject) {
664        return separateLineBetweenGroups
665                && getCountOfEmptyLinesBetween(
666                     previousImportObject.getEndLineNumber(),
667                     currentImportObject.getStartLineNumber()) != 1;
668    }
669
670    /**
671     * Examine that imports separated by more than one empty line.
672     *
673     * @param previousImportObject
674     *        previous import in current group.
675     * @param currentImportObject
676     *        current import.
677     * @return
678     *        true, if current import separated from previous by more that one empty line.
679     */
680    private boolean isSeparatedByExtraEmptyLine(ImportDetails previousImportObject,
681                                                ImportDetails currentImportObject) {
682        return previousImportObject != null
683                && getCountOfEmptyLinesBetween(
684                     previousImportObject.getEndLineNumber(),
685                     currentImportObject.getStartLineNumber()) > 0;
686    }
687
688    /**
689     * Log wrong import group order.
690     * @param currentImportLine
691     *        line number of current import current import.
692     * @param importGroup
693     *        import group.
694     * @param currentGroupNumber
695     *        current group number we are checking.
696     * @param fullImportIdent
697     *        full import name.
698     */
699    private void logWrongImportGroupOrder(int currentImportLine, String importGroup,
700            String currentGroupNumber, String fullImportIdent) {
701        if (NON_GROUP_RULE_GROUP.equals(importGroup)) {
702            log(currentImportLine, MSG_NONGROUP_IMPORT, fullImportIdent);
703        }
704        else if (NON_GROUP_RULE_GROUP.equals(currentGroupNumber)) {
705            log(currentImportLine, MSG_NONGROUP_EXPECTED, importGroup, fullImportIdent);
706        }
707        else {
708            log(currentImportLine, MSG_ORDER, importGroup, currentGroupNumber, fullImportIdent);
709        }
710    }
711
712    /**
713     * Get next import group.
714     * @param currentGroupNumber
715     *        current group number.
716     * @return
717     *        next import group.
718     */
719    private String getNextImportGroup(int currentGroupNumber) {
720        int nextGroupNumber = currentGroupNumber;
721
722        while (customImportOrderRules.size() > nextGroupNumber + 1) {
723            if (hasAnyImportInCurrentGroup(customImportOrderRules.get(nextGroupNumber))) {
724                break;
725            }
726            nextGroupNumber++;
727        }
728        return customImportOrderRules.get(nextGroupNumber);
729    }
730
731    /**
732     * Checks if current group contains any import.
733     * @param currentGroup
734     *        current group.
735     * @return
736     *        true, if current group contains at least one import.
737     */
738    private boolean hasAnyImportInCurrentGroup(String currentGroup) {
739        boolean result = false;
740        for (ImportDetails currentImport : importToGroupList) {
741            if (currentGroup.equals(currentImport.getImportGroup())) {
742                result = true;
743                break;
744            }
745        }
746        return result;
747    }
748
749    /**
750     * Get import valid group.
751     * @param isStatic
752     *        is static import.
753     * @param importPath
754     *        full import path.
755     * @return import valid group.
756     */
757    private String getImportGroup(boolean isStatic, String importPath) {
758        RuleMatchForImport bestMatch = new RuleMatchForImport(NON_GROUP_RULE_GROUP, 0, 0);
759        if (isStatic && customImportOrderRules.contains(STATIC_RULE_GROUP)) {
760            bestMatch.group = STATIC_RULE_GROUP;
761            bestMatch.matchLength = importPath.length();
762        }
763        else if (customImportOrderRules.contains(SAME_PACKAGE_RULE_GROUP)) {
764            final String importPathTrimmedToSamePackageDepth =
765                    getFirstDomainsFromIdent(samePackageMatchingDepth, importPath);
766            if (samePackageDomainsRegExp.equals(importPathTrimmedToSamePackageDepth)) {
767                bestMatch.group = SAME_PACKAGE_RULE_GROUP;
768                bestMatch.matchLength = importPath.length();
769            }
770        }
771        if (bestMatch.group.equals(NON_GROUP_RULE_GROUP)) {
772            for (String group : customImportOrderRules) {
773                if (STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE_RULE_GROUP.equals(group)) {
774                    bestMatch = findBetterPatternMatch(importPath,
775                            STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE_RULE_GROUP, standardPackageRegExp, bestMatch);
776                }
777                if (SPECIAL_IMPORTS_RULE_GROUP.equals(group)) {
778                    bestMatch = findBetterPatternMatch(importPath,
779                            group, specialImportsRegExp, bestMatch);
780                }
781            }
782        }
783        if (bestMatch.group.equals(NON_GROUP_RULE_GROUP)
784                && customImportOrderRules.contains(THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE_RULE_GROUP)
785                && thirdPartyPackageRegExp.matcher(importPath).find()) {
786            bestMatch.group = THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE_RULE_GROUP;
787        }
788        return bestMatch.group;
789    }
790
791    /**
792     * Tries to find better matching regular expression:
793     * longer matching substring wins; in case of the same length,
794     * lower position of matching substring wins.
795     *
796     * @param importPath
797     *      Full import identifier
798     * @param group
799     *      Import group we are trying to assign the import
800     * @param regExp
801     *      Regular expression for import group
802     * @param currentBestMatch
803     *      object with currently best match
804     * @return better match (if found) or the same (currentBestMatch)
805     */
806    private static RuleMatchForImport findBetterPatternMatch(String importPath, String group,
807            Pattern regExp, RuleMatchForImport currentBestMatch) {
808        RuleMatchForImport betterMatchCandidate = currentBestMatch;
809        final Matcher matcher = regExp.matcher(importPath);
810        while (matcher.find()) {
811            final int length = matcher.end() - matcher.start();
812            if (length > betterMatchCandidate.matchLength
813                    || length == betterMatchCandidate.matchLength
814                        && matcher.start() < betterMatchCandidate.matchPosition) {
815                betterMatchCandidate = new RuleMatchForImport(group, length, matcher.start());
816            }
817        }
818        return betterMatchCandidate;
819    }
820
821    /**
822     * Checks compare two import paths.
823     * @param import1
824     *        current import.
825     * @param import2
826     *        previous import.
827     * @return a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the
828     *        specified String is greater than, equal to, or less
829     *        than this String, ignoring case considerations.
830     */
831    private static int compareImports(String import1, String import2) {
832        int result = 0;
833        final String separator = "\\.";
834        final String[] import1Tokens = import1.split(separator);
835        final String[] import2Tokens = import2.split(separator);
836        for (int i = 0; i != import1Tokens.length && i != import2Tokens.length; i++) {
837            final String import1Token = import1Tokens[i];
838            final String import2Token = import2Tokens[i];
839            result = import1Token.compareTo(import2Token);
840            if (result != 0) {
841                break;
842            }
843        }
844        if (result == 0) {
845            result = Integer.compare(import1Tokens.length, import2Tokens.length);
846        }
847        return result;
848    }
849
850    /**
851     * Counts empty lines between given parameters.
852     * @param fromLineNo
853     *        One-based line number of previous import.
854     * @param toLineNo
855     *        One-based line number of current import.
856     * @return count of empty lines between given parameters, exclusive,
857     *        eg., (fromLineNo, toLineNo).
858     */
859    private int getCountOfEmptyLinesBetween(int fromLineNo, int toLineNo) {
860        int result = 0;
861        final String[] lines = getLines();
862
863        for (int i = fromLineNo + 1; i <= toLineNo - 1; i++) {
864            // "- 1" because the numbering is one-based
865            if (CommonUtil.isBlank(lines[i - 1])) {
866                result++;
867            }
868        }
869        return result;
870    }
871
872    /**
873     * Forms import full path.
874     * @param token
875     *        current token.
876     * @return full path or null.
877     */
878    private static String getFullImportIdent(DetailAST token) {
879        String ident = "";
880        if (token != null) {
881            ident = FullIdent.createFullIdent(token.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.DOT)).getText();
882        }
883        return ident;
884    }
885
886    /**
887     * Parses ordering rule and adds it to the list with rules.
888     * @param ruleStr
889     *        String with rule.
890     * @throws IllegalArgumentException when SAME_PACKAGE rule parameter is not positive integer
891     * @throws IllegalStateException when ruleStr is unexpected value
892     */
893    private void addRulesToList(String ruleStr) {
894        if (STATIC_RULE_GROUP.equals(ruleStr)
895                || THIRD_PARTY_PACKAGE_RULE_GROUP.equals(ruleStr)
896                || STANDARD_JAVA_PACKAGE_RULE_GROUP.equals(ruleStr)
897                || SPECIAL_IMPORTS_RULE_GROUP.equals(ruleStr)) {
898            customImportOrderRules.add(ruleStr);
899        }
900        else if (ruleStr.startsWith(SAME_PACKAGE_RULE_GROUP)) {
901            final String rule = ruleStr.substring(ruleStr.indexOf('(') + 1,
902                    ruleStr.indexOf(')'));
903            samePackageMatchingDepth = Integer.parseInt(rule);
904            if (samePackageMatchingDepth <= 0) {
905                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
906                        "SAME_PACKAGE rule parameter should be positive integer: " + ruleStr);
907            }
908            customImportOrderRules.add(SAME_PACKAGE_RULE_GROUP);
909        }
910        else {
911            throw new IllegalStateException("Unexpected rule: " + ruleStr);
912        }
913    }
914
915    /**
916     * Creates samePackageDomainsRegExp of the first package domains.
917     * @param firstPackageDomainsCount
918     *        number of first package domains.
919     * @param packageNode
920     *        package node.
921     * @return same package regexp.
922     */
923    private static String createSamePackageRegexp(int firstPackageDomainsCount,
924             DetailAST packageNode) {
925        final String packageFullPath = getFullImportIdent(packageNode);
926        return getFirstDomainsFromIdent(firstPackageDomainsCount, packageFullPath);
927    }
928
929    /**
930     * Extracts defined amount of domains from the left side of package/import identifier.
931     * @param firstPackageDomainsCount
932     *        number of first package domains.
933     * @param packageFullPath
934     *        full identifier containing path to package or imported object.
935     * @return String with defined amount of domains or full identifier
936     *        (if full identifier had less domain than specified)
937     */
938    private static String getFirstDomainsFromIdent(
939            final int firstPackageDomainsCount, final String packageFullPath) {
940        final StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder(256);
941        final StringTokenizer tokens = new StringTokenizer(packageFullPath, ".");
942        int count = firstPackageDomainsCount;
943
944        while (count > 0 && tokens.hasMoreTokens()) {
945            builder.append(tokens.nextToken()).append('.');
946            count--;
947        }
948        return builder.toString();
949    }
950
951    /**
952     * Contains import attributes as line number, import full path, import
953     * group.
954     */
955    private static class ImportDetails {
956
957        /** Import full path. */
958        private final String importFullPath;
959
960        /** Import start line number. */
961        private final int startLineNumber;
962
963        /**
964         * Import end line number.
965         * Note: It can be different from <b>startLineNumber</b> when import statement span
966         * multiple lines.
967         */
968        private final int endLineNumber;
969
970        /** Import group. */
971        private final String importGroup;
972
973        /** Is static import. */
974        private final boolean staticImport;
975
976        /**
977         * Initialise importFullPath, startLineNumber, endLineNumber, importGroup, staticImport.
978         * @param importFullPath
979         *        import full path.
980         * @param startLineNumber
981         *        import start line number.
982         * @param endLineNumber
983         *        import end line number.
984         * @param importGroup
985         *        import group.
986         * @param staticImport
987         *        if import is static.
988         */
989        /* package */ ImportDetails(String importFullPath, int startLineNumber, int endLineNumber,
990                                    String importGroup, boolean staticImport) {
991            this.importFullPath = importFullPath;
992            this.startLineNumber = startLineNumber;
993            this.endLineNumber = endLineNumber;
994            this.importGroup = importGroup;
995            this.staticImport = staticImport;
996        }
997
998        /**
999         * Get import full path variable.
1000         * @return import full path variable.
1001         */
1002        public String getImportFullPath() {
1003            return importFullPath;
1004        }
1005
1006        /**
1007         * Get import start line number.
1008         * @return import start line.
1009         */
1010        public int getStartLineNumber() {
1011            return startLineNumber;
1012        }
1013
1014        /**
1015         * Get import end line number.
1016         * @return import end line.
1017         */
1018        public int getEndLineNumber() {
1019            return endLineNumber;
1020        }
1021
1022        /**
1023         * Get import group.
1024         * @return import group.
1025         */
1026        public String getImportGroup() {
1027            return importGroup;
1028        }
1029
1030        /**
1031         * Checks if import is static.
1032         * @return true, if import is static.
1033         */
1034        public boolean isStaticImport() {
1035            return staticImport;
1036        }
1037
1038    }
1039
1040    /**
1041     * Contains matching attributes assisting in definition of "best matching"
1042     * group for import.
1043     */
1044    private static class RuleMatchForImport {
1045
1046        /** Position of matching string for current best match. */
1047        private final int matchPosition;
1048        /** Length of matching string for current best match. */
1049        private int matchLength;
1050        /** Import group for current best match. */
1051        private String group;
1052
1053        /**
1054         * Constructor to initialize the fields.
1055         *
1056         * @param group
1057         *        Matched group.
1058         * @param length
1059         *        Matching length.
1060         * @param position
1061         *        Matching position.
1062         */
1063        /* package */ RuleMatchForImport(String group, int length, int position) {
1064            this.group = group;
1065            matchLength = length;
1066            matchPosition = position;
1067        }
1068
1069    }
1070
1071}
